info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-client-oper
info.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG definitions
     for wireless client operational data.
     Copyright (c) 2016-2023 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

Cisco IOS-XE operational state data (read-only).
**Category:** Wireless
**Paths:** 53

**YANG Model:** [Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-client-oper.yang](https://github.com/YangModels/yang/blob/main/vendor/cisco/xe/17181/Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-client-oper.yang)

**📊 YANG Tree:** [View Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-client-oper structure](https://jeremycohoe.github.io/cisco-ios-xe-openapi-swagger/yang-trees/Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-client-oper.html)

current-switching-mode.description: Client traffic can be switched locally from Access Point or Centrally from the Wireless LAN Controller. Current switching mode indicates the type of switched used for the client traffic

wlan-switching-mode.description: All clients joined the Wireless LAN will have the same traffic switching mode. Wlan switching mode, which is initialized based on the WLAN properties

central-authentication.description: Indicator of whether the client is centrally through Wireless LAN Controller or locally through Access Point authenticated. NA for clients connected to Local Mode Access Points

central-dhcp.description: Indicator of whether the client is centrally through Wireless LAN Controller or locally through Access Point gets IP address using DHCP.

central-assoc-enable.description: Indicator of whether the client is centrally through Wireless LAN Controller or locally through Access Point gets Associated to the Wireless LAN.

vlan-central-switching.description: Client traffic can be switched locally from Access Point or Centrally from the Wireless LAN Controller. Vlan based switching mode indicates the client traffic is switched based on the vlan using central switching mode.

is-fabric-client.description: Indicator of whether the client is associated to Wireless WLAN broadcasted by Access Point in the Fabric Network.

is-guest-fabric-client.description: Indicator of whether the client is associated to Guest Wireless WLAN broadcasted by Access Point in the Fabric Network.

upn-bit-flag.description: Indicator of User Defined (Private) Network enabled status for the client.

wired-vlan.description: In wired guest scenario on Foreign controller: the VLAN the client joins and is learned

phy-ifid.description: In wired guest scenario on Foreign controller: the physical interface ID the clients joins

idle-time-seconds.description: For guest-lan clients on foreign controller, the idle time of the client, measured in seconds

items.description: PSK P2P tag value which is computed based on the wlan profile name and PSK passphrase

ms-ap-slot-id.description: Wireless access point slot ID to which client has connected, slot 255 represents invalid slot ID.

ms-radio-type.description: Radio type used to join AP

co-state.description: The state of the client indicates the last phase of the association the client has been able to complete successfully.

is-tvi-enabled.description: The Encrypted Traffic Analytics can be enabled on Wireless LANs. This flag indicates the enablement of the Encrypted Traffic Analytics for the client.

l3-vlan-override-received.description: Client received a VLAN Override after L3 authentication

is-central-nat.description: Is central NAT enabled for this Client

is-locally-administered-mac.description: Is client's MAC address locally administered

idle-timeout.description: Client idle state timeout: Amount of time before idle clients get deleted

idle-timestamp.description: Timestamp of when client moved to idle state

current-switching-mode.description: Client traffic can be switched locally from Access Point or Centrally from the Wireless LAN Controller. Current switching mode indicates the type of switched used for the client traffic

wlan-switching-mode.description: All clients joined the Wireless LAN will have the same traffic switching mode. Wlan switching mode, which is initialized based on the WLAN properties

central-authentication.description: Indicator of whether the client is centrally through Wireless LAN Controller or locally through Access Point authenticated. NA for clients connected to Local Mode Access Points

central-dhcp.description: Indicator of whether the client is centrally through Wireless LAN Controller or locally through Access Point gets IP address using DHCP.

central-assoc-enable.description: Indicator of whether the client is centrally through Wireless LAN Controller or locally through Access Point gets Associated to the Wireless LAN.

vlan-central-switching.description: Client traffic can be switched locally from Access Point or Centrally from the Wireless LAN Controller. Vlan based switching mode indicates the client traffic is switched based on the vlan using central switching mode.

is-fabric-client.description: Indicator of whether the client is associated to Wireless WLAN broadcasted by Access Point in the Fabric Network.

is-guest-fabric-client.description: Indicator of whether the client is associated to Guest Wireless WLAN broadcasted by Access Point in the Fabric Network.

upn-bit-flag.description: Indicator of User Defined (Private) Network enabled status for the client.

wlan-policy.description: Wireless LAN policy inherited by the wireless client after joining to the Wireless LAN.

wired-vlan.description: In wired guest scenario on Foreign controller: the VLAN the client joins and is learned

phy-ifid.description: In wired guest scenario on Foreign controller: the physical interface ID the clients joins

idle-time-seconds.description: For guest-lan clients on foreign controller, the idle time of the client, measured in seconds

items.description: PSK P2P tag value which is computed based on the wlan profile name and PSK passphrase

is-eogre.description: Whether this is an EoGRE client

previous-match-reason.description: Previous output of the match process of client to EoGRE client

match-reason.description: Output of the match process of client to EoGRE client

is-aaa-data.description: Is AAA override received for this client

vlan.description: Vlan tagging for EoGRE client traffic

primary-gw.description: IP address of the primary gateway

secondary-gw.description: IP address of the secondary gateway

plumbed-gw.description: Tunnel Gateway Name programmed to carry client traffic

is-hs20.description: is Hotspot 2.0 data received for this client

items.description: List of client's state backup servers

period.description: Period/interval to request measurements in seconds.

repeat-num.description: Number of times left to repeat requests.

repeat-forever.description: Present if continually repeating requests for measurements (until cleared).

all-cisco-operating-classes.description:
Present if requesting beacon measurements for all Cisco network channels in set of six
         operating classes: {81, 82, 115, 118, 121, 124}. False if requesting a single
         operating-class.

operating-class.description:
Specific operating class to request beacon measurements from. Only used if
         all-cisco-operating-classes is False. Validated operating classes are:
         81, 82, 115, 118, 121, 124.

channel-num.description:
Specific channel number to request beacon measurements for. A channel number
         of 0 indicates requesting for beacon measurements on all channels in the
         requested operating class.

meas-mode.description:
Measurement mode to control how requested beacon measurements are measured.
           (0) Passive - Passively measure beacons without probing.
           (1) Active - Actively measure beacons with probing.
           (2) Table - Report stored beacon measurements already received.

current-bssid.description:
True if BSSID/AP to request beacon measurements for will always be the BSSID of
         the AP the client is associated to.

bssid.description: BSSID to which client has associated

current-ssid.description:
True if SSID/WLAN to request beacon measurements for will always be the SSID of
         the WLAN the client is associated to.

ssid.description:
SSID name to request beacon measurements for. An empty (zero-length)
         SSID string is used to request beacon measurements for all WLAN/SSIDs,
         even from rogue networks/APs.

default-rand-interval.description:
True if the maximum start delay (randomization interval) for the client to start beacon
         measurements is set to the default of passive/active = 128 msec, table = 0 msec.

rand-interval.description:
Randomization Interval: Maximum measurement start delay for the client to randomly
         start the beacon measurement in msec.

default-meas-duration.description:
True if the measurement duration for the client to measure beacons is set to the default
         of passive = 112 msec, active = 112 msec, table = 0 msec.

meas-duration.description: Measurement Duration: Maximum measurement duration for client to measure beacons in msec.

dialog-token.description: Dialog token used in the last request, beginning from 1 and wrapping at 255.

last-req-trigger.description: Action which triggered the last request to be sent.

last-req-time.description: Timestamp of when last request was sent.

next-req-time.description: Timestamp of when next request will be sent.

last-report-time.description: Timestamp of when the last beacon scan report was received.

capable.description: Indicates whether client is cellular capable

wifi-direct-capable.description: Whether client is WiFi direct capable

is-wlan-infra-managed.description: Whether client is capable of being managed by the WLAN

is-concurrent-oper-capable.description: Whether client supports concurrent operation with WLAN

is-providing-xconnect.description: Whether client is hosting a P2P Group that provides cross connection

sta-mac.description: STA or Link MAC address of the client

bss-mac-addr.description: BSS MAC or AP MAC address of the link

radio-type.description: Type of the Radio of the AP to which the client is associated

ms-mac-address.description: MAC Address of the wireless mobile station. MAC addresses are used as a network address for most IEEE 802 network technologies, including Ethernet, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.

ms-bssid.description: Basic Service Set Identifier to which the Mobile station is connected. MAC addresses are used as a network address for most IEEE 802 network technologies, including Ethernet, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.

ap-mac-address.description: MAC Address of the Access Point to which the client has joined. MAC addresses are used as a network address for most IEEE 802 network technologies, including Ethernet, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.

current-channel.description: Current Channel on which the wireless client is communicating with Access Point in the wireless LAN.

ms-wlan-id.description: Wireless LAN ID to which the client is connected in the wireless network.

vap-ssid.description: Service Set Identifier (SSID) of the Wireless LAN to which the client is connected.

policy-profile.description: Policy profile applied on the Wireless LAN to which the wireless client is connected

ms-association-id.description: Association ID of the mobile station

ms-reason-code.description: Updated when the mobile station sends an unsolicited deauthentication or disassociation frame

is-11g-client.description: Flag indicating whether the client is connected through IEEE 802.11g protocol

ms-supported-rates-str.description: Supported radio rates by mobile station

ms-wme-enabled.description: Indicator whether Wireless Multimedia Extensions is enabled, or not

dot11w-enabled.description: Flag indicator for IEEE 802.11w feature is enabled

ewlc-ms-phy-type.description: Radio PHY type to which the wireless mobile station is connected

encryption-type.description: Encryption policy used by the client while communicating with Access Point.

security-mode.description: Security mode for the client association

client-wep-policy-type.description: Client Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) policy type

bss-trans-capable.description: Indicator whether the client is IEEE 802.11v capable

ms-apple-capable.description: Indicator whether client has Fastlane Support

wlan-profile.description: Profile applied on the Wireless/Remote/Guest LAN to which the client is connected

dms-capable.description: Indicator if client is Directed Multicast Service (DMS) Capable

wtc-support.description: Client's WIFI to cellular steering support

wtc-resp.description: Indicates whether client send WIFI to cellular response in BSS transition response

wtc-resp-code.description: Client's WIFI to cellular response code

dot11-6ghz-cap.description: Indicates whether this client is 6Ghz capable

link-local-enable.description: Indicates whether the link-local bridging feature is enabled for this client

link-local-vlan-id.description: The link-local bridge VLAN for this client

emlr-mode.description: Enhanced multilink radio operation mode supported by the client

str-capable.description: Simultaneous transmit and receive capable in multi link operation

ms-wifi.description: WiFi security of Mobile Station used during the association.

is-eogre.description: Whether this is an EoGRE client

previous-match-reason.description: Previous output of the match process of client to EoGRE client

match-reason.description: Output of the match process of client to EoGRE client

is-aaa-data.description: Is AAA override received for this client

vlan.description: Vlan tagging for EoGRE client traffic

primary-gw.description: IP address of the primary gateway

secondary-gw.description: IP address of the secondary gateway

plumbed-gw.description: Tunnel Gateway Name programmed to carry client traffic

is-hs20.description: is Hotspot 2.0 data received for this client

items.description: List of client's state backup servers

period.description: Period/interval to request measurements in seconds.

repeat-num.description: Number of times left to repeat requests.

repeat-forever.description: Present if continually repeating requests for measurements (until cleared).

all-cisco-operating-classes.description:
Present if requesting beacon measurements for all Cisco network channels in set of six
         operating classes: {81, 82, 115, 118, 121, 124}. False if requesting a single
         operating-class.

operating-class.description:
Specific operating class to request beacon measurements from. Only used if
         all-cisco-operating-classes is False. Validated operating classes are:
         81, 82, 115, 118, 121, 124.

channel-num.description:
Specific channel number to request beacon measurements for. A channel number
         of 0 indicates requesting for beacon measurements on all channels in the
         requested operating class.

meas-mode.description:
Measurement mode to control how requested beacon measurements are measured.
           (0) Passive - Passively measure beacons without probing.
           (1) Active - Actively measure beacons with probing.
           (2) Table - Report stored beacon measurements already received.

current-bssid.description:
True if BSSID/AP to request beacon measurements for will always be the BSSID of
         the AP the client is associated to.

bssid.description:
BSSID/AP to request beacon measurements for. The wildcard BSSID is used to request
         beacon measurements for all neighboring BSSs/APs.

current-ssid.description:
True if SSID/WLAN to request beacon measurements for will always be the SSID of
         the WLAN the client is associated to.

ssid.description:
SSID name to request beacon measurements for. An empty (zero-length)
         SSID string is used to request beacon measurements for all WLAN/SSIDs,
         even from rogue networks/APs.

default-rand-interval.description:
True if the maximum start delay (randomization interval) for the client to start beacon
         measurements is set to the default of passive/active = 128 msec, table = 0 msec.

rand-interval.description:
Randomization Interval: Maximum measurement start delay for the client to randomly
         start the beacon measurement in msec.

default-meas-duration.description:
True if the measurement duration for the client to measure beacons is set to the default
         of passive = 112 msec, active = 112 msec, table = 0 msec.

meas-duration.description: Measurement Duration: Maximum measurement duration for client to measure beacons in msec.

dialog-token.description: Dialog token used in the last request, beginning from 1 and wrapping at 255.

last-req-trigger.description: Action which triggered the last request to be sent.

last-req-time.description: Timestamp of when last request was sent.

next-req-time.description: Timestamp of when next request will be sent.

last-report-time.description: Timestamp of when the last beacon scan report was received.

dot11k-rm-beacon-meas-req-parameters.description: 802.11k Radio Measurement for Beacon Report Request (Client Scan Report)

capable.description: Indicates whether client is cellular capable

wifi-direct-capable.description: Whether client is WiFi direct capable

is-wlan-infra-managed.description: Whether client is capable of being managed by the WLAN

is-concurrent-oper-capable.description: Whether client supports concurrent operation with WLAN

is-providing-xconnect.description: Whether client is hosting a P2P Group that provides cross connection

ms-mac-addr.description: MAC address of wireless mobile station

mm-client-role.description: Mobility role of wireless mobile stations on Wireless LAN Controller

mm-client-roam-type.description: Roam type indicates Layer 2 or Layer 3 mobility roam by client

mm-instance.description: Move count of client indicating number of inter-controller roams performed by client

mm-complete-timestamp.description: Timestamp at which mobility discovery was completed for client

mm-remote-tunnel-ip.description: Primary IP address of mobility peer for an anchor or foreign client

mm-remote-tunnel-sec-ip.description: Secondary IP address of mobility peer for an anchor or foreign client

mm-remote-platform-id.description: Platform ID of mobility peer for an anchor or foreign client

mm-remote-tunnel-id.description: Mobility peer tunnel identifier for an anchor or foreign client

mm-anchor-ip.description: Anchor wireless LAN controller's address for a foreign client

instance-id.description: Wireless management process instance to which client has associated

run-latency.description: Time taken by client to reach 'RUN' state

instance-id.description: Wireless management process instance to which client has associated

ms-ap-slot-id.description: Wireless access point slot ID to which client has connected, slot 255 represents invalid slot ID.

bssid.description: BSSID to which client has associated

ap-name.description: Name of wireless access point to which client has associated

run-latency.description: Time taken by client to reach 'RUN' state

mobility-history.description: Client association and mobility history of client

bytes-rx.description: The number of bytes of wireless data traffic received from the Mobile station on a particular Wireless LAN.

bytes-tx.description: The number of bytes of wireless data traffic transmitted to the Mobile station on a particular Wireless LAN.

pkts-rx.description: The number of packets of wireless data traffic received from the Mobile station on a particular Wireless LAN.

pkts-tx.description: The number of packets of wireless data traffic transmitted to the Mobile station on a particular Wireless LAN.

data-retries.description: The number of retries a wireless mobile station has executed for the wireless data traffic on a particular Wireless LAN.

rts-retries.description: Number of frames received with the retry bit set

mic-mismatch.description: The number of packets from wireless mobile station for which Message Integrity Check (MIC) mismatch occured on a particular Wireless LAN.

mic-missing.description: The number of packets from wireless mobile station for which Message Integrity Check (MIC) missing occured on a particular Wireless LAN.

most-recent-rssi.description: RSSI is the relative received signal strength in a wireless environment, is an indication of the power level being received by the receive radio after the antenna and possible cable loss. Last updated Radio Signal Strength indicator is recorded.

most-recent-snr.description: Signal-to-noise ratio (abbreviated SNR or S/N) is a measure used in science and engineering that compares the level of a desired signal to the level of background noise. Last updated Signal To Noise Ratio is recorded.

tx-retries.description: Number of frames transmitted with the Retry bit set

speed.description: Latest speed of the connected client.

spatial-stream.description: Number of Spatial Streams supported by the client.

client-active.description: Identification for client status as active

glan-stats-update-timestamp.description: For guest-lan clients, time when statistics were last updated

glan-idle-update-timestamp.description: For guest-lan clients, time when idle time was last updated

rx-group-counter.description: The total count of broadcast and multicast frames sent by the client

tx-total-drops.description: Number of packets which failed to be transmitted to the client for any reason

last-stats-update.description: Last updated time of client statistics

band-id.description: Radio Band where the client has connected

mlo-mac-addr.description: Multi-link MAC address of the wireless mobile station. MAC addresses are used as a network address for most IEEE 802 network technologies, including Ethernet, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.

total-links-dropped.description: No. of links dropped due to downsizing to max links supported

protocol-map.description: A Map of Protocols used for Device Classification

sw-version-src.description: Network Protocol used as a source of device's software version info

device-os-src.description: Network Protocol used as a source of device's operating system info

device-vendor-src.description: Network Protocol used as a source of device's vendor info

sales-code-src.description: Network Protocol used as a source of device's sales code info

device-src.description: Network Protocol used as a source of device's form info

country-name-src.description: Network Protocol used as a source of device's country name info

model-name-src.description: Network protocol used as a source of device model name info

power-type-src.description: Network protocol used as a source of device power type info

hw-model-src.description: Network protocol used as a source of device hardware model info

current-switching-mode.description: Client traffic can be switched locally from Access Point or Centrally from the Wireless LAN Controller. Current switching mode indicates the type of switched used for the client traffic

wlan-switching-mode.description: All clients joined the Wireless LAN will have the same traffic switching mode. Wlan switching mode, which is initialized based on the WLAN properties

central-authentication.description: Indicator of whether the client is centrally through Wireless LAN Controller or locally through Access Point authenticated. NA for clients connected to Local Mode Access Points

central-dhcp.description: Indicator of whether the client is centrally through Wireless LAN Controller or locally through Access Point gets IP address using DHCP.

central-assoc-enable.description: Indicator of whether the client is centrally through Wireless LAN Controller or locally through Access Point gets Associated to the Wireless LAN.

vlan-central-switching.description: Client traffic can be switched locally from Access Point or Centrally from the Wireless LAN Controller. Vlan based switching mode indicates the client traffic is switched based on the vlan using central switching mode.

is-guest-fabric-client.description: Indicator of whether the client is associated to Guest Wireless WLAN broadcasted by Access Point in the Fabric Network.

upn-bit-flag.description: Indicator of User Defined (Private) Network enabled status for the client.

wired-vlan.description: In wired guest scenario on Foreign controller: the VLAN the client joins and is learned

phy-ifid.description: In wired guest scenario on Foreign controller: the physical interface ID the clients joins

items.description: PSK P2P tag value which is computed based on the wlan profile name and PSK passphrase

client-mac.description: MAC Address of the wireless mobile station. MAC addresses are used as a network address for most IEEE 802 network technologies, including Ethernet, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.

ap-name.description: The Access Point name to which the client is connected in the Wireless Network

ms-ap-slot-id.description: The radio slot on the access point to which the client is connected in the wireless network, slot 255 represents invalid slot ID.

ms-radio-type.description: The Wireless Radio type of the client using which it has connected to the Access Point in the Wireless Network

wlan-id.description: Wireless LAN Id indicates the unique Wireless LAN to which the client is connected

client-type.description: Client traffic can be switched locally from Access Point in HREAP mode or Centrally from the Wireless LAN Controller in the Local mode. Client Type indicates the wireless network type to which the client is connected based on the traffic switching type.

co-state.description: The state of the client indicates the last phase of the association the client has been able to complete successfully.

is-tvi-enabled.description: The Encrypted Traffic Analytics can be enabled on Wireless LANs. This flag indicates the enablement of the Encrypted Traffic Analytics for the client.

l3-vlan-override-received.description: Client received a VLAN Override after L3 authentication

idle-timeout.description: Client idle state timeout: Amount of time before idle clients get deleted

idle-timestamp.description: Timestamp of when client moved to idle state

current-switching-mode.description: Client traffic can be switched locally from Access Point or Centrally from the Wireless LAN Controller. Current switching mode indicates the type of switched used for the client traffic

wlan-switching-mode.description: All clients joined the Wireless LAN will have the same traffic switching mode. Wlan switching mode, which is initialized based on the WLAN properties

central-authentication.description: Indicator of whether the client is centrally through Wireless LAN Controller or locally through Access Point authenticated. NA for clients connected to Local Mode Access Points

central-dhcp.description: Indicator of whether the client is centrally through Wireless LAN Controller or locally through Access Point gets IP address using DHCP.

central-assoc-enable.description: Indicator of whether the client is centrally through Wireless LAN Controller or locally through Access Point gets Associated to the Wireless LAN.

vlan-central-switching.description: Client traffic can be switched locally from Access Point or Centrally from the Wireless LAN Controller. Vlan based switching mode indicates the client traffic is switched based on the vlan using central switching mode.

is-fabric-client.description: Indicator of whether the client is associated to Wireless WLAN broadcasted by Access Point in the Fabric Network.

is-guest-fabric-client.description: Indicator of whether the client is associated to Guest Wireless WLAN broadcasted by Access Point in the Fabric Network.

upn-bit-flag.description: Indicator of User Defined (Private) Network enabled status for the client.

wlan-policy.description: Wireless LAN policy inherited by the wireless client after joining to the Wireless LAN.

wired-vlan.description: In wired guest scenario on Foreign controller: the VLAN the client joins and is learned

phy-ifid.description: In wired guest scenario on Foreign controller: the physical interface ID the clients joins

idle-time-seconds.description: For guest-lan clients on foreign controller, the idle time of the client, measured in seconds

items.description: PSK P2P tag value which is computed based on the wlan profile name and PSK passphrase

is-eogre.description: Whether this is an EoGRE client

previous-match-reason.description: Previous output of the match process of client to EoGRE client

match-reason.description: Output of the match process of client to EoGRE client

is-aaa-data.description: Is AAA override received for this client

vlan.description: Vlan tagging for EoGRE client traffic

primary-gw.description: IP address of the primary gateway

secondary-gw.description: IP address of the secondary gateway

plumbed-gw.description: Tunnel Gateway Name programmed to carry client traffic

is-hs20.description: is Hotspot 2.0 data received for this client

items.description: List of client's state backup servers

period.description: Period/interval to request measurements in seconds.

repeat-num.description: Number of times left to repeat requests.

repeat-forever.description: Present if continually repeating requests for measurements (until cleared).

all-cisco-operating-classes.description:
Present if requesting beacon measurements for all Cisco network channels in set of six
         operating classes: {81, 82, 115, 118, 121, 124}. False if requesting a single
         operating-class.

operating-class.description:
Specific operating class to request beacon measurements from. Only used if
         all-cisco-operating-classes is False. Validated operating classes are:
         81, 82, 115, 118, 121, 124.

channel-num.description:
Specific channel number to request beacon measurements for. A channel number
         of 0 indicates requesting for beacon measurements on all channels in the
         requested operating class.

meas-mode.description:
Measurement mode to control how requested beacon measurements are measured.
           (0) Passive - Passively measure beacons without probing.
           (1) Active - Actively measure beacons with probing.
           (2) Table - Report stored beacon measurements already received.

current-bssid.description:
True if BSSID/AP to request beacon measurements for will always be the BSSID of
         the AP the client is associated to.

bssid.description:
BSSID/AP to request beacon measurements for. The wildcard BSSID is used to request
         beacon measurements for all neighboring BSSs/APs.

current-ssid.description:
True if SSID/WLAN to request beacon measurements for will always be the SSID of
         the WLAN the client is associated to.

ssid.description:
SSID name to request beacon measurements for. An empty (zero-length)
         SSID string is used to request beacon measurements for all WLAN/SSIDs,
         even from rogue networks/APs.

default-rand-interval.description:
True if the maximum start delay (randomization interval) for the client to start beacon
         measurements is set to the default of passive/active = 128 msec, table = 0 msec.

rand-interval.description:
Randomization Interval: Maximum measurement start delay for the client to randomly
         start the beacon measurement in msec.

default-meas-duration.description:
True if the measurement duration for the client to measure beacons is set to the default
         of passive = 112 msec, active = 112 msec, table = 0 msec.

meas-duration.description: Measurement Duration: Maximum measurement duration for client to measure beacons in msec.

dialog-token.description: Dialog token used in the last request, beginning from 1 and wrapping at 255.

last-req-trigger.description: Action which triggered the last request to be sent.

last-req-time.description: Timestamp of when last request was sent.

next-req-time.description: Timestamp of when next request will be sent.

last-report-time.description: Timestamp of when the last beacon scan report was received.

capable.description: Indicates whether client is cellular capable

wifi-direct-capable.description: Whether client is WiFi direct capable

is-wlan-infra-managed.description: Whether client is capable of being managed by the WLAN

is-concurrent-oper-capable.description: Whether client supports concurrent operation with WLAN

is-providing-xconnect.description: Whether client is hosting a P2P Group that provides cross connection

sta-mac.description: STA or Link MAC address of the client

bss-mac-addr.description: BSS MAC or AP MAC address of the link

radio-type.description: Type of the Radio of the AP to which the client is associated

ms-bssid.description: Basic Service Set Identifier to which the Mobile station is connected. MAC addresses are used as a network address for most IEEE 802 network technologies, including Ethernet, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.

ap-mac-address.description: MAC Address of the Access Point to which the client has joined. MAC addresses are used as a network address for most IEEE 802 network technologies, including Ethernet, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.

current-channel.description: Current Channel on which the wireless client is communicating with Access Point in the wireless LAN.

ms-wlan-id.description: Wireless LAN ID to which the client is connected in the wireless network.

vap-ssid.description: Service Set Identifier (SSID) of the Wireless LAN to which the client is connected.

policy-profile.description: Policy profile applied on the Wireless LAN to which the wireless client is connected

ms-ap-slot-id.description: Slot ID of the access point radio on which the wireless client is connected, slot 255 represents invalid slot ID.

ms-association-id.description: Association ID of the mobile station

ms-reason-code.description: Updated when the mobile station sends an unsolicited deauthentication or disassociation frame

ms-assoc-time.description: The time at which the association request is received from the mobile station to wireless LAN.

is-11g-client.description: Flag indicating whether the client is connected through IEEE 802.11g protocol

ms-supported-rates-str.description: Supported radio rates by mobile station

ms-wme-enabled.description: Indicator whether Wireless Multimedia Extensions is enabled, or not

dot11w-enabled.description: Flag indicator for IEEE 802.11w feature is enabled

ewlc-ms-phy-type.description: Radio PHY type to which the wireless mobile station is connected

encryption-type.description: Encryption policy used by the client while communicating with Access Point.

security-mode.description: Security mode for the client association

client-wep-policy-type.description: Client Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) policy type

bss-trans-capable.description: Indicator whether the client is IEEE 802.11v capable

ms-apple-capable.description: Indicator whether client has Fastlane Support

wlan-profile.description: Profile applied on the Wireless/Remote/Guest LAN to which the client is connected

dms-capable.description: Indicator if client is Directed Multicast Service (DMS) Capable

wtc-support.description: Client's WIFI to cellular steering support

wtc-resp.description: Indicates whether client send WIFI to cellular response in BSS transition response

wtc-resp-code.description: Client's WIFI to cellular response code

dot11-6ghz-cap.description: Indicates whether this client is 6Ghz capable

link-local-enable.description: Indicates whether the link-local bridging feature is enabled for this client

link-local-vlan-id.description: The link-local bridge VLAN for this client

emlr-mode.description: Enhanced multilink radio operation mode supported by the client

str-capable.description: Simultaneous transmit and receive capable in multi link operation

ms-wifi.description: WiFi security of Mobile Station used during the association.

is-eogre.description: Whether this is an EoGRE client

previous-match-reason.description: Previous output of the match process of client to EoGRE client

match-reason.description: Output of the match process of client to EoGRE client

is-aaa-data.description: Is AAA override received for this client

vlan.description: Vlan tagging for EoGRE client traffic

primary-gw.description: IP address of the primary gateway

secondary-gw.description: IP address of the secondary gateway

plumbed-gw.description: Tunnel Gateway Name programmed to carry client traffic

is-hs20.description: is Hotspot 2.0 data received for this client

items.description: List of client's state backup servers

mm-client-role.description: Mobility role of wireless mobile stations on Wireless LAN Controller

mm-client-roam-type.description: Roam type indicates Layer 2 or Layer 3 mobility roam by client

mm-instance.description: Move count of client indicating number of inter-controller roams performed by client

mm-complete-timestamp.description: Timestamp at which mobility discovery was completed for client

mm-remote-tunnel-ip.description: Primary IP address of mobility peer for an anchor or foreign client

mm-remote-tunnel-sec-ip.description: Secondary IP address of mobility peer for an anchor or foreign client

mm-remote-tunnel-id.description: Mobility peer tunnel identifier for an anchor or foreign client

mm-anchor-ip.description: Anchor wireless LAN controller's address for a foreign client

instance-id.description: Wireless management process instance to which client has associated

ms-ap-slot-id.description: Wireless access point slot ID to which client has connected, slot 255 represents invalid slot ID.

bssid.description: BSSID to which client has associated

ap-name.description: Name of wireless access point to which client has associated

run-latency.description: Time taken by client to reach 'RUN' state

mobility-history.description: Client association and mobility history of client

ap-name.description: Name of wireless access point to which client has associated

run-latency.description: Time taken by client to reach 'RUN' state

mobility-history.description: Client association and mobility history of client

ms-mac-address.description: MAC Address of the wireless mobile station. MAC addresses are used as a network address for most IEEE 802 network technologies, including Ethernet, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.

bytes-rx.description: The number of bytes of wireless data traffic received from the Mobile station on a particular Wireless LAN.

bytes-tx.description: The number of bytes of wireless data traffic transmitted to the Mobile station on a particular Wireless LAN.

pkts-rx.description: The number of packets of wireless data traffic received from the Mobile station on a particular Wireless LAN.

pkts-tx.description: The number of packets of wireless data traffic transmitted to the Mobile station on a particular Wireless LAN.

data-retries.description: The number of retries a wireless mobile station has executed for the wireless data traffic on a particular Wireless LAN.

rts-retries.description: Number of frames received with the retry bit set

mic-mismatch.description: The number of packets from wireless mobile station for which Message Integrity Check (MIC) mismatch occured on a particular Wireless LAN.

mic-missing.description: The number of packets from wireless mobile station for which Message Integrity Check (MIC) missing occured on a particular Wireless LAN.

most-recent-rssi.description: RSSI is the relative received signal strength in a wireless environment, is an indication of the power level being received by the receive radio after the antenna and possible cable loss. Last updated Radio Signal Strength indicator is recorded.

most-recent-snr.description: Signal-to-noise ratio (abbreviated SNR or S/N) is a measure used in science and engineering that compares the level of a desired signal to the level of background noise. Last updated Signal To Noise Ratio is recorded.

tx-retries.description: Number of frames transmitted with the Retry bit set

speed.description: Latest speed of the connected client.

spatial-stream.description: Number of Spatial Streams supported by the client.

client-active.description: Identification for client status as active

glan-stats-update-timestamp.description: For guest-lan clients, time when statistics were last updated

glan-idle-update-timestamp.description: For guest-lan clients, time when idle time was last updated

rx-group-counter.description: The total count of broadcast and multicast frames sent by the client

tx-total-drops.description: Number of packets which failed to be transmitted to the client for any reason

last-stats-update.description: Last updated time of client statistics

band-id.description: Radio Band where the client has connected

ms-mac-address.description: MAC Address of the wireless mobile station. MAC addresses are used as a network address for most IEEE 802 network technologies, including Ethernet, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.

bytes-rx.description: The number of bytes of wireless data traffic received from the Mobile station on a particular Wireless LAN.

bytes-tx.description: The number of bytes of wireless data traffic transmitted to the Mobile station on a particular Wireless LAN.

pkts-rx.description: The number of packets of wireless data traffic received from the Mobile station on a particular Wireless LAN.

pkts-tx.description: The number of packets of wireless data traffic transmitted to the Mobile station on a particular Wireless LAN.

data-retries.description: The number of retries a wireless mobile station has executed for the wireless data traffic on a particular Wireless LAN.

rts-retries.description: Number of frames received with the retry bit set

mic-mismatch.description: The number of packets from wireless mobile station for which Message Integrity Check (MIC) mismatch occured on a particular Wireless LAN.

mic-missing.description: The number of packets from wireless mobile station for which Message Integrity Check (MIC) missing occured on a particular Wireless LAN.

most-recent-rssi.description: RSSI is the relative received signal strength in a wireless environment, is an indication of the power level being received by the receive radio after the antenna and possible cable loss. Last updated Radio Signal Strength indicator is recorded.

most-recent-snr.description: Signal-to-noise ratio (abbreviated SNR or S/N) is a measure used in science and engineering that compares the level of a desired signal to the level of background noise. Last updated Signal To Noise Ratio is recorded.

tx-retries.description: Number of frames transmitted with the Retry bit set

speed.description: Latest speed of the connected client.

spatial-stream.description: Number of Spatial Streams supported by the client.

client-active.description: Identification for client status as active

glan-stats-update-timestamp.description: For guest-lan clients, time when statistics were last updated

glan-idle-update-timestamp.description: For guest-lan clients, time when idle time was last updated

rx-group-counter.description: The total count of broadcast and multicast frames sent by the client

tx-total-drops.description: Number of packets which failed to be transmitted to the client for any reason

last-stats-update.description: Last updated time of client statistics

band-id.description: Radio Band where the client has connected

ms-mac-address.description: MAC Address of the wireless mobile station. MAC addresses are used as a network address for most IEEE 802 network technologies, including Ethernet, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.

bytes-tx.description: The number of bytes of wireless data traffic transmitted to the Mobile station on a particular Wireless LAN.

pkts-tx.description: The number of packets of wireless data traffic transmitted to the Mobile station on a particular Wireless LAN.
